title: Harold the Hungry Plant
description: When April's dad surprises her with a pitcher plant, she names him Harold and learns all about how to take care of him. She feeds him ants and spiders, but what Harold really wants is a red jellybean! Will April share one with him? Harold the Hungry Plant is an engaging and entertaining story filled with colorful illustrations and detailed sentences that make the story come alive. The book can also be used to teach students how to make inferences and draw conclusions as well as to retell to better understand the story.
meta: Insects, jellybeans, ooze, pitcher plant, tank, tasty
Make Inferences/Draw Conclusions : Make inferences and draw conclusions
Quotation Marks : Recognize and use quotation marks
Alphabetical Order : Place words in alphabetical order
